Standard Edition

Fisherwomen by Craig Easton

A twenty-four page 11" × 15" portfolio publication, Fisherwomen showcases images from a long-term project exploring the traditional and contemporary importance of women to the fishing industry.

Following the historic route of the old herring fleet from Shetland to Great Yarmouth, the work presents intimate colour portraits of former and present-day fisherwomen alongside exquisite large format black & white landscapes. Combined with personal testimonies, the photographs weave a compelling tale of a unique phenomenon in the history of British women at work.

All editions come with Fisherwomen & Photography, an A5 four page insert written by Rachel Nordstrum, Photographic Collections Manager at the University of St Andrews.
